availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Nathan Hall (Woodford County, Kentucky, waggoner, farmer, and town marshal)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, waggoner and town marshal. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda S. Filson Hall in Woodford County, Kentucky, on September 25, 1855. Father of A. E. Hall, Nattie Hall, Mollie Hall, and Bartie Hall. Waggoner in Woodford County in 1860. Employed John Taylor as a waggoner in Woodford County in 1860. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863. Town marshal of Versailles in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 962.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 530A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Woodford County, KY, July 1863.
"Moses Nathan Hall (1830-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial #195620006, accessed January 28, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195620006.
KYR-0001-004-0304.
